intro: Mammillaria centricirrha f. recurva, commonly known as the recurved mammillaria, is a unique cactus species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in dense, white to pale green spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its growth habit is typically solitary or in small clusters, and it thrives in well-drained soil with minimal water. This variety is prized by cactus enthusiasts for its compact size and distinctive, recurved spines.
